by Graham Williams

Section L CTAN Edition

Welcome to the XML based and XSL generated version of The TeX Catalogue Online, Section L CTAN Edition. This is a listing of entries in the TeX Catalogue and may take a little time to load, but is hopefully worth it. Have a look at the Catalogue Preface for alternative ways of accessing the catalogue.

The TeX Catalogue Online is also available from any CTAN node or mirror, including the following. Pick one that is close to you. (The "search" link attempts to find a CTAN node that may be close to you, courtesy of Randy Kobes. Multiple clicks may find alternatives.)



search

aarnet

switch

cstug

dante

loria

tex

roma

riken

gust

rge

ctan

Icons associated with many entries in the catalogue allow you to:

  • view the directory on CTAN
  • view documentation (possibly many)
  • view documentation in PDF format (requires the acroread plugin)
  • jump to the package's home page
  • download a gzip'd tar file from a nearby CTAN node (not supported by all nodes)
  • download a gzip'd tar file from ftp.dante.de

Other icons simply provide further information about the package:

  • part of the teTeX distribution
  • available on the TeX Live CD ROM

The license type, version (if known), and the date of the last change made to each particular Catalogue entry are also provided.

This compilation Copyright (c) 1998, 1999 Graham J. Williams. Last modified 1999/05/13.

Use of these web documents and information contained herein is subject to the CSIRO Legal Notice and Disclaimer.

labels No caption.
Support for printing sheets of sticky labels (but could also be used for business cards). The number of rows and columns of labels, and their size, can be changed.
license: dfsg (1999/03/03)
lamstex A merge of the best in AMS-TeX and LaTeX.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
lastpage No caption.
Reference the number of pages in your LaTeX document (as in a page footer that says: Page N of M).
license: nosell (1999/03/03)
lated No caption.
A graphical editor for drawings in the LaTeX ``picture'' environment. It runs under MS-DOS and MS-Windows. The distribution includes full sources, including LaTeX source for its documentation.
license: unknown version: 1.1 (1998/02/11)
latex No caption.
LaTeX is a (and probably the most) popular macro package for TeX, providing many basic document formating commands extended by many of the packages included in this current list. See also latex2e latex209
license: lppl version: June 98 (1998/07/2)
latex209 The pre-1993 LaTeX, now no longer supported.
See also latex2e latex
license: lppl (1996/07/4)
latex2e Documentation on LaTeX2e in OS/2 hypertext format and html.
See also latex latex209
license: lppl (1996/07/4)
latex2html No caption.
A Perl program that translates LaTeX into HTML (HyperText Markup Language) creating separate HTML files corresponding to each unit (e.g., section) of the document. See also ltoh hyperlatex tth techexplorer
license: lppl (1996/07/8)
latex2man No caption.
A tool to translate UNIX manual pages written with LaTeX into a man-page format, HTML, or TexInfo.
license: lppl version: 1.6 (1998/09/9)
latex2rtf No caption.
Translates LaTeX text into RTF (Rich Text Format as used by Microsoft Word). See also tex2rtf
license: lppl (1998/11/17)
latexcad A CAD drawing package.
license: lppl (1998/03/20)
latexfonts No description available.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
latexmk No caption.
An excellent utility for Unix which deals with the task of running LaTeX the appropriate number of times to ensure cross-references, etc., are completely defined. Also supports printing and viewing. See also latexn prv
license: lppl version: 2.0 (1997/01/12)
latexn No caption.
A csh script to run LaTeX as many times as needed (and hopefully no more) on a given file to resolve cross references, and to ensure that the table of contents and index (if any) are up-to-date. See also latexmk
license: lppl (1997/11/27)
latin2jk No caption.
A definition file for the inputenc package, where all characters from IS=-8859-2 (Latin-2) are loaded as text characters. This allows verbatim setting of Latin-2 encoded files.
license: unknown (1997/10/7)
layout Produces an overview of the layout of the current document.
See also layouts
license: unknown version: 1.2b (1998/08/13)
layouts Display various elements of a document's layout.
This includes: text positioning on a page; disposition of floats; layout of paragraphs, lists, footnotes, table of contents, and sectional headings; font boxes. Facilities are provided for a document designer to experiment with the layout parameters. See also layout isostds
license: lppl (1999/04/15)
leaflet No caption.
A document class to create small hand-outs that fit on a single sheet of paper which is then folded twice, with a script to rearrange pages so that they print correctly (on a PostScript printer) on a single sheet.
license: unknown (1998/09/30)
leftidx Left subscripts and superscripts in math mode.
These subscripts and superscripts are automatically raised for better fitting to the symbol they belong to.
license: lppl (1999/03/29)
letter The standard LaTeX2e letter document class.
license: unknown (1998/11/6)
letterspacing Letter spacing.
license: lppl (1999/04/8)
lettrine Typeset dropped capitals.
Supports various dropped capitals styles, typically those described in the French typographic books.
license: lppl version: 1.0 (1999/04/2)
levy Macros for using Silvio Levy's Greek fonts.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
lexikon Implements commands to generate a two language dictionary.
license: lppl (1998/04/1)
lgreek Macros for using Silvio Levy's Greek fonts.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
lgrind No caption.
Prepares various programming language source code (e.g., C, C plus plus, Pascal, BASIC, Modula-2, Fortran, RATFOR Yacc, PostScript, Prolog, MLisp, Icon, LaTeX, Perl, CSH Bourne Shell, assembler, 68000 assembler, asm68 VMS assembler, ISP, LDL, Linda, MODEL, MatLab, Russell) for pretty-printing within LaTeX. See also lgrind-win32
license: unknown version: 3.51 (1998/08/5)
lgrind-win32 No caption.
A version of lgrind for MS-Windows32 systems.
license: unknown (1998/03/24)
lh No caption.
The lh fonts for the `T2'/X2 encodings (for cyrillic languages).
license: unknown (1998/10/2)
lhcyr No caption.
A collection of three LeTeX 2e styles intended for typesetting Russian and bilingual English-Russian documents: lhcyralt, lhcyrkoi, and lhcyrwin.
license: unknown (1999/01/21)
lilypond Support for music notation.
GNU LilyPond is a program which converts music definition files into visual or auditive output. LilyPond can typeset formatted sheet music to a TeX file and (mechanical) performances to MIDI files.
license: gpl version: 1.0.17 (1999/03/03)
lineno No caption.
Adds line numbers to selected paragraphs with reference possible through the LaTeX \ref and \pageref cross reference mechanism. See also numline
license: lppl version: 2.04 (1999/03/03)
linguex No caption.
A package to facilitate the formatting of linguist examples, automatically taking care of example numbering, indentations, indexed brackets, and the ``*'' in grammaticality judgments.
license: unknown (1998/06/1)
lintex No caption.
A C program that removes auxilliary TeX and LaTeX files that are usually not needed after a run (log, aux, dvi, files), and only if their modification time is more recent than the source.
license: unknown version: 1.04 (1998/06/16)
lips Text ellipses in LaTeX.
A LaTeX package defining \lips, which generates text ellipses that are closer to what The Chicago Manual of Style suggests than what \dots produces. It does the right thing in most circumstances, and so is easier to use, as well.
license: gpl version: 2 1999/02/28 (1999/03/10)
listings A package for typesetting listings using LaTeX2e.
The source code is read directly by TeX. Keywords, comments and strings can be typeset using different styles, e.g., default is bold for keywords, italic for comments and no special style for strings.
license: unknown version: 0.19 (1998/11/11)
lkort No description available.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
llncs No caption.
Document style for submissions to Springer-Verlag's Lecture Notes in Computer Science series.
license: unknown (1996/10/4)
localloc Macros for localizing TeX register allocations.
license: dfsg (1999/03/03)
logic A MetaFont font for drawing logic diagrams.
license: unknown (1997/05/3)
logo-ps PostScript fonts for the logo font.
license: unknown (1998/07/25)
lollipop A new generation format.
license: nocommercial (1999/03/03)
longtable Support for tables longer than a page.
Generally easier to use and more flexible than supertabular . See also supertabular
license: lppl (1999/03/03)
losymbol Defines a lot of symbol macros.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
lscape Place selected parts of a document in landscape.
Modifies the margins and rotates the page contents but not the page number. Useful, for example, with large multipage tables, and is compatible with longtable and supertabular . See also rotating
license: lppl version: 3.0 (1999/03/03)
lshort-english A (Not So) Short Introduction to LaTeX2e.
A (Not So) Short Introduction to LaTeX2e. See also gentl-gr lshort-finnish lshort-french lshort-german lshort-mongolian lshort-russian lshort-spanish
license: dfsg version: 3.7 (1999/04/16)
lshort-finnish No caption.
Finnish version of A Short Introduction to LaTeX2e with an emphasis on Finnish typesetting rules.
license: unknown (1999/01/21)
lshort-french No caption.
French version of A Short Introduction to LaTeX2e.
license: unknown (1998/02/5)
lshort-german German version of A Short Introduction to LaTeX2e.
license: dfsg (1999/05/18)
lshort-mongolian No caption.
Mongolian version of A Short Introduction to LaTeX2e .
license: unknown (1999/01/30)
lshort-polish Introduction to LaTeX in Polish.
This is the Polish translation of A Short Introduction to LaTeX2e .
license: unknown (1999/02/25)
lshort-russian No caption.
Russian version of A Short Introduction to LaTeX2e.
license: unknown (1998/10/13)
lshort-spanish No caption.
Spanish version of A Short Introduction to LaTeX2e.
license: unknown (1999/01/21)
ltablex No caption.
Modifies the tabularx environment to combine the features of the tabularx package (auto-sized columns in a fixed width table) with those of the longtable package (multi-page tables).
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
ltnews The latest LaTeX news.
license: unknown (1999/03/25)
ltoh A converter from LaTeX to HTML.
See also latex2html tth ltx2x techexplorer
license: unknown version: 98a (1998/04/8)
ltx2rtf A conversion program from LaTeX to Rich Text Format.
license: unknown (1998/12/28)
ltx2x No caption.
A program to replace LaTeX commands by user-defined characters. Typical uses are for deTeXing and pretty-printing, or for replacing LaTeX commands by SGML, HTML, and RTF tags, etc. See also latex2html tth ltoh techexplorer
license: pd (1999/03/03)
ltxbase The core LaTeX.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
ltxdoc Class for documented LaTeX2e classes.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
ltxinput No caption.
An MSDOS utility which recursively searches a file for input (and include) statements, writing a list of files which are input to stdout and to a batch file which sets an environmental variable LTXINPUT to point to this filelist. The C source, MSDOS binary, documentation and test files are included in the distribution.
license: unknown (1996/11/26)
ltxmisc Miscellaneous LaTeX styles.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
ltxsrc The core source files for LaTeX2e.
license: unknown (1996/05/16)
ltxtable Longtable and tabularx merge.
See also longtable tabularx
license: lppl version: 1995/12/11 v0.2 (1999/04/15)
lucida Package to make Lucida Bright fonts usable with LaTeX.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
lucold No caption.
A package to switch the rendering of all the digits to the so-called ``old-style'' numbers, when using Lucida fonts. The switch affects all digits in text mode, or all digits in text and math mode. It works both for normal weight and boldface text and math; since the boldface old-style digits are in the ``Lucida Expert'' font set, you need it for the boldface digits. Includes a set of AWK programs used to automatically build fd, tfm and vf files from the existing Lucida PSNFSS distribution, and that may easily changed for the generation of different virtual files for whatever font.
license: unknown (1998/02/4)
lw35nfsx No caption.
LaTeX psnfss support for the 35 printer resident PostScript fonts using ly1 text font encoding, employing the Berry names. This is similar to the existing lw35nfss.zip support using T1/TS1, but much simpler (lw35nfsx.zip is about 150k bytes while lw35nfss.zip is about 800 kbytes). It includes needed additions to dvips 's psfonts.map, TFM metric files for TeX, FD font definition files, and STY files for LaTeX.
license: unknown (1998/07/28)
ly1 Support for LY1 LaTeX encoding, i.e.
the Y&Y texnansi (TeX 'n ANSI) encoding.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
